results.title: Sorting (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
Sets out the basic principles behind the course and presents the fundamentals of set theory. It progresses from a discussion of sorting objects to matching elements from one set with those of another to the concept of mathematical patterns

results.title: Probability 1 : counting techniques
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Associates and ACCESS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics for modern living”.
This episode from the “Mathematics for modern living” series introduces the concepts of chance and probability through examples of everyday life. It discusses games of chance and everyday space, closely followed by counting techniques. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A study guide accompanies this tape.

results.title: Coordinate graphing 2
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Associates and ACCESS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics for modern living”.
This episode from the “Mathematics for modern living” series teaches the basics of graphing including the slope of the line, oblique, horizontal and vertical, then progresses onto graphing linear equations (slope intercept method), two firstdegree linear equations and graphing linear inequations. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A study guide accompanies this tape.

results.title: Probability 2
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Associates and ACCESS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics for modern living”.
This episode from the “Mathematics for modern living” series is a continuation of “Probability 1” (see 309029) and covers the areas of; formulas for finding permutations of n, probability of two mutually exclusive events and two independent events. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A study guide accompanies this tape.

results.title: Muchmore's marvellous machine
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Mathematics for elementary school students: whole numbers”.
Introduces children to the mathematical whole number concept of the decimal system. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: Fun and games
results.creator_credit: Colin Nobbs, Adam Hart-Davis and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematical eye”.
This program consists entirely of short mathematical puzzles that students answer using problem-solving techniques. It also presents games that can be played in the classroom and a basic introduction to algebra.

results.title: Paper engineering
results.creator_credit: Colin Nobbs, Adam Hart-Davis and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematical eye”.
This program provides an introduction to geometry. It includes useful demonstrations showing how manufacturers use geometric principles to design packaging and how a variety of geometric shapes can be made by folding paper. The distinction is made between two and three dimensional shapes and the mathematical link between geometric shapes is explored.

results.title: Mathematical eye
results.creator_credit: Mike Cocker, Colin Nobbs, Adam Hart-Davis and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description: A series of 20 minute programs designed to help students understand mathematical concepts and relate them to the real world. The programs use computer graphics and animation to assist students in visualising problems and solutions.
